abstract: Barnes & Noble removes all physical DC Comics titles from their shelves following Amazon's exclusive tablet deal with the publisher, saying it refuses to carry any book if bookseller is denied the rights to sell the digital version; Books-a-Million, the third-largest bookseller, follows suit.
snippet: Amazon struck a deal for the exclusive digital rights to a hundred graphic novels by DC Comics, leading Barnes & Noble and Books-a-Million to remove the novels from their shelves.
lead_paragraph: Amazon struck a deal for the exclusive digital rights to a hundred graphic novels by DC Comics, leading Barnes & Noble and Books-a-Million to remove the novels from their shelves.

headline.main: In a Battle of the E-Readers, Booksellers Spurn Superheroes
headline.print_headline: In a Battle of the E-Readers, Booksellers Spurn Superheroes
headline.seo: Bookstores Drop Comics After Amazon Deal With DC
